title: The Rise of Industrial Software
author: Chris Loy
key_concepts: Industrial Software Revolution - AI-driven automation transforming software from craft to manufacture
Disposable Software - Low-cost, low-value outputs with no expectation of long-term maintenance
Jevons Paradox - How efficiency improvements paradoxically increase overall consumption
Innovation vs Industrialization - Dual forces driving software progress
Technical Debt as Pollution - The environmental cost of mass automation
relevance_to_mcp_critique: Article provides broader context for understanding industrialization of software development, disposable software concept, and the stewardship challenge that relates to MCP's complexity and maintenance concerns
